body.p: The Boards considered the feedback received on the 2010 Exposure Draft and observed that it would not be possible to reflect the views of all stakeholders because stakeholders did not have a united view of the economics of leases. However, in response to views that the economics of leases can be different the Boards decided to develop a revised model that identified two classes of leases and specified different requirements for each type. The classification depended on the extent to which the lessee was expected to consume the economic benefits embedded in the underlying asset.
